item.title: Report X-2024040840
item.description:
Report X-2024040840

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON THE NC ROLLERS AT DOOR 10 WITH A DAMP BASE. NO LIQUID DRIPPING ONTO THE FLOOR. IMMEDIATELY PLACED INTO LINED HAZMAT TOTE DescribePack: BOTH CAPS ON BOTH BOTTLES, DESPITE HAVING SEAL TAPE ACROSS THE TOP OF THEM, WERE SLIGHTLY LOOSE. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY PLACED INTO LINED HAZMAT TOTE

item.title: Report X-2024040839
item.description:
Report X-2024040839

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Operations administrator witnessed a package handler carry the package from the trailer to the NC rollers improperly, causing the package handler to drop the hazmat package. Package was then immediately taken and placed into a lined hazmat tote. DescribePack: Split seam along the body of the inner flexible plastic. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately placed into a lined hazmat tote.

item.title: Report E-2024040013
item.description:
Report E-2024040013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6100
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/28/2024, at 1745 hours, personnel in the CSXT Maxwell Yard discovered WCHX 30209, a loaded tank car of acetone, leaking from the top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Ineos Phenol Inc, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024032800201). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found three of four bolts on the liquid line valve mounting flange were less than tool tight. Contractor personnel tightened the liquid line flange bolts to stop the release and decontaminated the residue material from the side of the tank car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Marcelles Prather, Marcelles.Prather@Ineos.com, 251-463-6082). The car was held out of Transporation pending additional repair by a certified repair shop or One Time Movement Approval from FRA.

item.title: Report E-2024040404
item.description:
Report E-2024040404

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-15
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHILE DRIVER PERFORMED A PRE-TRIP INSPECTION AT TERMINAL. DRIVER NOTICED A VERY SLIGHT LEAK FROM UNDER THE TRAILER. INVESTIGATION SHOWED THE EXTERNAL PACKING NUT WAS LOOSE CAUSING THE LEAK. THE PACKING NUT WAS PROPERLY SECURED BY SITE MECHANIC. SPILL WAS CLEANED UP BY PLANT PERSONNELL.

item.title: Report X-2024040608
item.description:
Report X-2024040608

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON THE FLOOR AT THE 100 BELT ON THE CART SIDE, WITH THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX OPEN AND CONTENTS (GRANULES) LEAKING OUT. ERIC BEST REPORTED THE HAZMAT IMMEDIATELY AND THEN IMMEDIATELY PLACED IT INTO A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: BOTTOM OF THE BODY OF THE BUCKET CRACKED, APPROX. 2.5 TO 3 INCHES LONG. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO LINED HAZMAT BUCKET UPSIDE DOWN TO PREVENT FURTHER LEAKAGE
